title: Asian American Social Movements
description: History of Asian American activism from the late-nineteenth century to the present, with an emphasis on interethnic, interracial, and transnational solidarity practices. Topics include struggles for civil rights and labor rights; immigration reform; antiwar and anticolonial movements; hate crimes; and police brutality. Students may receive credit for one of the following: HIUS 125, HIUS 125GS, or ETHN 163J.
